## A Note From the Crucible

This song was forged in the space between abandonment and awakening‚Äîwhere I discovered that love isn't something we lose, but something we become. 

The "hooks in my back" metaphor came during a somatic therapy session when I finally felt the physical weight of childhood trauma. The bridge emerged whole during a sunrise meditation‚Äîproof that wholeness was never lost, only forgotten.

**Clinical Insight:**  
This song operationalizes **Polyvagal Theory** through musical narrative. The progression from dorsal shutdown ("stood frozen") to ventral safety ("open skies") mirrors nervous system healing.

> For my sons: this is the map I wish I'd had. May it guide you through storms I couldn't weather.

The concentric growth model ("made me who I am") rejects linear healing myths‚Äîwe spiral upward through layers of understanding.
